channel.title: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-
channel.description:
So i Stumbled upon a online school for website development etc, and since this is web development fourm section thought i would share
It costs 300$ Not much for school!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=trueview-instream&v=ZUAg51kA42M
https://teamtreehouse.com/
IF THIS BELONGS IN GENERAL PROGRAMMING OR DISCUSSION PLEASE MOVE!

item.title: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

$300 isn’t too much, however, if you allocate the time into teaching yourself, you’ll find it isn’t too hard. You’ll have some struggles learning along the way, but you’ll get it eventually. Plus, us here on Moparscape are always here to help you, and assist you with what you need (along with many other coding forums.) I would recommend teaching yourself, you get a better and more in-depth understanding of what you’re learning, and you save $300 that you can spend on something more useful. However, if you choose to take online courses, you’ll definitely make that $300 back. As Ruby stated he did, I make quite a bit of money off website development too. To make back that $300 it would take two (possibly three,) websites. Each site taking about two hours, which isn’t too bad. So it’s up to you, but I’d recommend teaching yourself as you’ll get a more in-depth understanding of what you’re learning.

Read full topic
item.source: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-

item.title: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:7, topic:481301”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=599540.msg4213071#msg4213071 date=1359853294]
Guess what. It cuts out human error and heads straight to the word of the developers of PHP!
[/quote]

Implying PHP developers are not human and don’t make mistakes![/quote]
No, I’m implying that 3rd party lecturers etc will often come under an accumulation of error while learning and then that could be passed on to you. I’d rather go to the documentation directly.

Read full topic
item.source: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-

item.title: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

I’ve heard pretty good things about treehouse. There are tons of online tutorials, books and other things though, free of charge, online. Read a few books online, try things out for yourself then if you’re having trouble with something, StackOverflow and Google.

For me though, sometimes I have issues with motivation and ideas and if I were paying $300, I definitely wouldn’t want to be procrastinating.

Read full topic

item.title: TheTreeHouse -If Not sutable enough for here move-
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“pkerjosh123, post:1, topic:481301”]So i Stumbled upon a online school for website development etc, and since this is web development fourm section thought i would share

It costs 300$ Not much for school!

Treehouse

Start Learning at Treehouse for Free

Learn web design, coding and much more with Treehouse. You can learn at your own pace and become job ready within months. Start your free trial!

IF THIS BELONGS IN GENERAL PROGRAMMING OR DISCUSSION PLEASE MOVE![/quote]
Wait.
I know a better one.

Codecademy

Codecademy - learn to code, interactively, for free

Codecademy is the world's most popular way to learn over 12 coding languages including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, and Ruby. Sign up today and start learning to code in minutes.

Guess what. It’s free.

Read full topic
